page.title: 15FARM LIVESTOCK
page.content: {DAIRY COWS}Herds up to 300 cows and followers, mostly Friesian which strip or paddock graze (heavily fertilized) ryegrass leys in Spring and Summer and in Winter eat silage and hay or barley straw with additional protein feed if needed. Cows are housed in cubicles with followers in yards.They are milked in Parlours. Tankers collect milk for the Marketing Board. {SHEEP}Northern cross ewes,Mules put to Suffolk, Texel or Dorset rams lambed in Spring and sold for meat with fleece as a by-product, shorn late May with travelling New Zealanders helping shepherds. Stubble turnips are grown for Winter feeding. {PIGS}are intensively housed for bacon. {PONIES}A smallholder rears Welsh Ponies. {BEES}Bee-hives set in clover and rape fields at flowering time produce honey
